alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 03 at 3:59PM AKDT until September 04 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Tanana River from Delta Junction to Fairbanks. * WHEN...Until noon AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is occurring in low lying areas along the Tanana River from Delta to Nenana. In Fairbanks, from some water remains ponded on portions of Perkins Drive, Melanie Lane, and Chief John Drive. Several driveways and yards have water in them. High water is also occuring around the boat landing at Whitestone Farms near Delta Junction. Minor flooding or bankfull conditions are expected through Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 346 PM AKDT, Heavy rain that fell over the Alaska Range the past week is causing high water on the Nenana and Tanana Rivers. This has caused the Tanana River to rise to bankfull and overbank in some locations. Water levels are expected to drop very slowly the next several days. - For those recreating or hunting on the Tanana River, all gravel bars will be covered with water, debris will be in the river, along with increased erosion. Be cautious of rising water levels if you plan to park your vehicle near the river while out on your boat. - For Tanana River at Big Delta: Flood Stage is 23.0 feet. The current river level is 20.6 feet and forecast to fall slowly. For Tanana River at Fairbanks: Flood Stage is 24.5 feet. At 3:15pm Sunday the stage was 24.2 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Tanana River from Delta Junction to Fairbanks stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley
